conclusion: Object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane, object A is at a height of 1 m above the ground, the inclined plane is sufficiently long, and friction is negligible.
The string is attached to the pulley, and the connection between object B and the string breaks at the moment object A hits the ground.
The acceleration due to gravity is \( g = 10 \, \text{m/s}^2 \).
When object A hits the ground, the kinetic energy of object A is converted into potential energy of object B.
The kinetic energy of object A just before it hits the ground is \( \frac{1}{2}mv_A^2 \), and the potential energy of object B just after it hits the ground is \( mgh \).
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is given by \( t = \frac{2h}{v_B} \), where \( v_B \) is the velocity of object B just after it hits the ground.

The velocity of object B just after it hits the ground is given by \( v_B = v_A \sin \theta \), where \( v_A \) is the velocity of object A just before it hits the ground, and \( \theta \) is the angle of the inclined plane.

Substituting \( v_A = 1 \, \text{m/s} \), \( \theta = 37^{\circ} \), and \( h = 1 \, \text{m} \), we calculate \( v_B = 1 \, \text{m/s} \sin 37^{\circ} = 1 \, \text{m/s} \times 0.64 = 0.64 \, \text{m/s} \).
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane from the moment object A hits the ground is \( 3.125 \, \text{s} \).
